website_summaries.verdict: One of the most secure and stylish solutions for money and credit card storage available.
pros: No fasteners or clips to cause chafing
Can even hold items such as insulin pumps and gel packs
cons: Finding the right size can be challenging
Belt can ride up or invert during strenuous exercise

customer_reviews.title: Pear-shaped females should avoid this product!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this, as I hate running with my phone on an armband. The belt rode up from where I placed it on my hips almost immediately (less than .25 mile) and bounced around my waist for the rest of the run. Note: I am a pear shaped female (28" waist, size 8 clothing) and ordered the size large to fit on the upper part of my hips. I think I could have ordered an XXL and it still wouldn't have stayed in place - it would have ridden up due to my body shape alone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You wont even notice you are wearing it!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive to add any bulk to my midsection but this belt works great! It looks like a yoga pant waistband and is very comfortable. My waist is 30" and my hip measurement (which is wear I wanted to wear it) was 38". I ordered the large (32-35"). It fits perfectly and stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Rocknstuff

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical about this actually staying in place. ...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this actually staying in place. I carry my weight around my midsection. It stayed in place while running and walking on the road and on the treadmill. I'm trying to lose all my pregnancy weight so I'll update as I lose weight. For reference, I'm 5'6 and wear an 8/10 US size. This belt is a large.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Order up 2 sizes.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 0-2 pant. I ordered a medium belt. I definitely would not have liked a small. Medium is fitted on my waist, I may have even picked a large if I was able to try on before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Shopper

customer_reviews.title: This is a knock off
customer_reviews.text: Totally a knock off - must be made in China or some other Asian country. . Broken English on the tag. Certainly not in the English of the USA. “ Freeing both hands and freely travel”, “Comfirm your belongings has been completely into Flipbelt pocket”, “ Put Flipbelt on the soles of your foot and put in waist clothesinner or external”. Also there is no key ring hook at all.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Picked wrong size based off of someone else's review; UPDATE: there are 2 different size charts.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this for my wife. I went based off the review that someone else wrote regarding size. I bought a medium. Turns out I should've bought a large. I'm attaching a pic of the updated size chart that came with the belt (which matches the sizes offered when you place your order). Not sure if they will exchange my purchase. UPDATE: went ahead and reordered in Large. Fit my wife just right but turns out that the size chart on this belt was different than the one on the Medium belt I first ordered. Amazon should recheck all its inventory. Very confusing. Glad I don't have to make another return.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Ortega

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've ever made.
customer_reviews.text: This may sound like hyperbole, but this thing is truly amazing. I tried getting back into running early this year, but trying to carry my phone and a key made it very problematic. Having them in your pocket is uncomfortable, those horrible arm bands are just the absolute worst. Fanny packs are clunky and bounce around. This thing totally changed my life. (Again, sounds like hyperbole, but I swear it is not). I have since gotten so into running that I run about 20 miles per week and I've lost probably 40-50 lbs. It's so comfortable you forget it's there. One of the best purchases I've ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Jack P. Lasley

customer_reviews.title: I was sent a knock off..
customer_reviews.text: I received a knockoff. I kept the item only because it works like I needed it to and didn't want to return it and have to wait another 2 weeks and also pay another $15 but for one I knew was real. The only branding on it was the size tag. No pamphlet and a plastic bag. If this is like the FlipBelt, It fits an Iphone 5s & 6Plus, keys and other misc items.
customer_reviews.author: Marv Riley

customer_reviews.title: Wrinkles doesnt stay flat, returning expensive
customer_reviews.text: Nice color and concept but when I tried it on it wrinkled and wouldn't stay flat like the picture. My things inside felt awkward too, I think I need a wider belt. I was allowed to return it in new condition with tags but sadly only got a refund for around $6, I paid $19. I bought two of these one for my sisters birthday but from another seller, with that one I recieved back around $16, I paid the same amount for it too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Workout Belt!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great workout belt! I was unsure of what size to order after reading the reviews. Decided to go on the smaller side and purchase an XS. I am 5"3 125 lbs and it fits perfect over a shirt and I think it would be great if you just workout in a sports bra as well. Super soft material but durable. I will probably wash it on delicate cycle when needed. Does not ride up at all when walking and running. I have a Samsung Note and was worried it wouldn't fit inside, but it does! No zippers but amazingly nothing falls out. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicki O

customer_reviews.title: ** Used at LRock & Disney **
customer_reviews.text: I ran the 2017 Little Rock Marathon (6 hrs) and the 2018 Disney Marathon (7 hrs) before giving it a review. I'm 125-130 lbs, 5'4, 34-B(minus) and I bought a small. I wear it under my costumes and I'm a slow runner but I've been running for years and have tried a lot of stuff. The belt makes you sweat so I freeze my bars, raisins and PB&J's before sliding them in so they don't mush. Sometimes the belt bounces around or rides up and sometimes while running you can feel your box of raisins but struggle getting it out, but I'm sticking with my FlipBelt because it works for me and I haven't found anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Boys

customer_reviews.title: It has one job and fails to do it. Has nobody heard of zippers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically to hold wallet, car key fob, and glasses. Key fob fell out on a run. Goodbye, $200. But hey, then I saw the little clip and realized it was for holding keys, so maybe that was my fault? Then today, my phone and glasses both fell out at different places along a four mile run. O hard the phone make its exit and was able to recover it, but I had no idea when the glasses fell out. Goodbye to another $200 I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Alex E.

customer_reviews.title: and it's so comfortable I forget it's on
customer_reviews.text: This has transformed my running. Keeps my keys and phone in place, and it's so comfortable I forget it's on. This fits just like the fold-over part of a pair of yoga pants. It also has, so far, kept my phone dry even though I'm the sweatiest girl on the planet. Really. I'm super gross. But my phone is not, and that's all to the FlipBelt Waist Pouch. Bonus: the key clip is attached to the belt with elastic, so I can open my door without fumbling to unclip the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L.

customer_reviews.title: Seams will rip on bigger phones
customer_reviews.text: I actually loved the product when it arrived. It fit great, it held everything that I needed, and it looked great. The issue is the durability. I have only owned the product for a couple of days and the seams are falling apart. The situatiin is that I took my phone out of its case so that it did not stress the seams. I put the phone in the storage area. As I put the phone (Note 5) in, the seams ripped in two different spots.
customer_reviews.author: Harris072

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea
customer_reviews.text: I could not get my Phone 5s out of the belt because the openings are too small. The phone has a form fitting protective case so it is not bulky. It did not fit well and was really hot against my skin. I love the idea.....maybe it needs to be reengineered. It did appear to be well made. I ordered a size Large because I did not want it to be snug and could wear it with various types of clothing. I had to return it for the reason stated.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Dallura

customer_reviews.title: Great - you need this for running (with a phone).
customer_reviews.text: Just buy the Flip Belt - its great. I use it for my iPhone 7 Plus and it fits in there. For a marathon, I can get the phone, keys, and a few gels in there. It does not move when running and holds everything firm. I use Apple Ear Pods and not having a wire is great, but I also used to use this with wired headphones and that worked too. I have about a 29 or 30 inch waist and I get the small. This is my 2nd belt. I still use the other one - just wanted a 2nd one in black.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, on par with fanny pack.
customer_reviews.text: I wish i had ordered a size smaller than I did. It seems to stretch a little with wear, and it was on the loose side to begin with. I also might sew a couple of vertical lines to keep items limited to one side or another. My things go around and around inside like I a jacket with holes in the pockets. Nothing stays where you put it. Also, I thin the stitching will come loose soon at the openings from the amount that I have to stretch them to put in my Samsumg Galaxy S8. Once inside, it fits fine and slides arou d with everything else, but it is hard to get in and out.
customer_reviews.author: hiwesunshine

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for runners!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this belt! I can easily fit everything I need (either my iPod or iPhone, chapstick, keys, and energy gels), my items stay secure in the belt and area easy to retrieve while running, it doesn't ride up or slip down, and it's really comfortable! I've tried a couple of other products and have had issues with them either stretching and therefore moving up or down while running, or they've been uncomfortable because they're positioned in a way where the items in the belt put pressure on my hips or abdomen. The FlipBelt is so comfortable that I don't even notice I'm wearing it. Added bonus, it's machine washable so really easy to clean. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was a pain in the ass. It rolled ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain in the ass. It rolled up higher and higher around my waist until it was nearly around my ribs, and my phone wouldn't fit while in its case. Really not a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Selkie

customer_reviews.title: Not just for working out
customer_reviews.text: While I bought this belt for running, which it is perfect for by the way, I find myself wearing this quite often to carry my phone (I have an iPhone 8 Plus that fits snug but nicely), credit cards, keys, chapstick and whatever else my wife would put in her purse but she doesn't carry one so I am stuck with everything. What's so great about this is that you don't even know you are wearing it and with an untucked shirt neither does anyone else. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Robbie G

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful tool!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to run. After several uses it does *slightly* ride up, but just machine wash/dry it to restore it's size. I like that this is easy to hide under my work out shirt so I don't look like I'm wearing a fanny pack. I carry my phone, key fob, and more. I also like that if I wear black pants, it looks like it's the waistband for the pants. Very inconspicuous. I wear this to run but I can't wait to wear it to a public venue like a concert or even the airport. I hate carrying my purse. This is a great hands free alternative.
customer_reviews.author: ml

customer_reviews.title: Great for Disney
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for Disney. If you don't want to carry around around a back pack, this can comfortably carry the essentials. We are DVC members and annual pass holders. So you need to flash those two cards around disney for discounts, so you cant really leave without them. So being able to carry those cards, cell phone, possibly an external battery. All very convenient. It has been used for several years now and still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best cellphone holder on the market
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used it daily for the past two months. I am able to run outdoors and work out at the gym knowing that my phone, keys and money are all secure. After I finish my workouts, I have difficulty remembering where I placed my phone until I realize that it’s in my Flipbelt...it’s that comfortable! No wonder why it’s the best selling exercise belt on the market. Price is a bit high, but for the design and quality, it’s worth it. I even bought one for my girlfriend.
customer_reviews.author: Land Shark

customer_reviews.title: Not overly impressed
customer_reviews.text: I really don't care for this belt. The first race I used this for, I lost my ID and money. Thankfully running people are wonderful and it was turned into the police and returned. I just took it for another run last weekend, and my iPhone 6 was slipping out the whole time, and this this twists up like crazy. It rides up and doesn't stay put on my waist. The only thing I like is that I can snake my earbuds under my clothes. I'll most likely be looking for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Bop

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I waited until I had 5 runs under my belt (brewhaha) before writing this review. I’ve now worn this on long runs (6 miles) and for shorter speed interval runs. It never moves. NEVER. And when a crap song sneaks onto my playlist, it’s super easy to pull out my phone to fast forward the music without having to stop my run. Also, my Sunday run ended up being in the dark this week because of DLST. I typically don’t run in the dark so don’t have much gear for that. Luckily I bought this in neon yellow so it helped keep me safe. This may be my favorite purchase in years on this site. Can’t more highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: trayler

customer_reviews.title: Keeps items in place, but constantly rolls and bunches
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Misses size 14, so I ordered the pouch in X-Large. It was great for holding my keys and iPod Touch in place, but the back of the pouch kept rolling and bunching up to where I would have to adjust it every couple of minutes. It's now relegated to the drawer in case I need to use it in a pinch, but wearing it for daily runs hasn't worked out for me. Maybe if I had washboard abs it would have stayed in place better.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: High quality but a couple things I didn’t like.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this belt is higher than I expected. The only thing is that a couple of strings were fraying which made me wonder if I would have to re-sew in the near future. Also the color is not carbon. It’s a very dark green. I wish flipbelt came in navy. I don’t like black and I’m not a fan of neon particularly for every day wear. Also it’s very expensive. I only bought it because the carbon was $19. What I really wanted was the zipper version but that was $36! It seems a little pricey. I would pay $25 for the zippered one and $20 for non-zippered.
customer_reviews.author: Junebug

customer_reviews.title: Great product... fits a lot of stuff... but competitive runners beware.
customer_reviews.text: There are pros and cons depending on the type of runner you are. If you are a competitive race runner, this thing is actually kinda heavy and does feel a little hot on your waist depending on the weather. However, if you are running for leisure and need to put your phone and keys in here it will definitely do that job for you and fit much more. I think this is great, but if you are a competitive runner I’m not sure about strapping this on for a half marathon or a marathon. Probably best to invest in a watch at that point. Great product, but I am indifferent!
customer_reviews.author: Anton Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my exercise walks. I ordered the medium based on the size chart - I’m a woman, size 8, definitely have wider hips. I was concerned about how it would go over my hips and whether it would sit properly. I’ve had no significant issues so far. I would recommend following the size chart and not ordering bigger. It gets a little bunched in the back, but I only notice it when I put my hands back there. It doesn’t make it uncomfortable to wear. The pocket fits my iPhone XS with the case on. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ACSN

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and practical
customer_reviews.text: Ordered internationally so I really didn't want to deal with a potential return due to incorrect sizing. After combing through plenty of reviews and rechecking the size chart I opted for XS (23" waist and 35" hips), ideally wearing the belt around my hip bones. Perfect fit! Doesn't budge while running and held up during a rainy outdoor half marathon beautifully! The non-zipper edition I find sturdy enough to carry my keys (always clasped on the attached ring then tucked in for extra safety) and my huge note 5 enclosed in its wallet casing. Just a wonderfully efficient and practical running belt, and helped me transition from treadmill to outdoors well!
customer_reviews.author: AMB

customer_reviews.title: The design is poor and the lack of zippers
customer_reviews.text: This is now the second time this product has cost me a lot of money. The design is poor and the lack of zippers, snaps or velcro makes it very likely that money or other objects will fall out! One time we lost $100 and so after used it only for things that are less likely to fall out based on shape, or so we thought. Now we lost a credit card and had to cancel it, wait for a new one etc. Stay Away!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Items fell out twice. not sure
customer_reviews.text: I am still trying to find the best way to use it. The belt looks nice. Feels good and fits perfectly. However. I've had items fell out of it. Fortunate enough both times I felt it right away and picked it up. Once was my ID card. Once was my Airpods. So now when I put my cards in I put them standing position in the front where I can check it anytime which it's working so far. I adjust the belt often if I've been bending my body.
customer_reviews.author: Marina Bruce David

customer_reviews.title: it's a great concept but for people like me with big hips- ...
customer_reviews.text: i'm giving this product only two stars because i used the size chart and ordered a large but it's nowhere near big enough to sit low on my waist (as in most of the product photos) i also have hips that don't lie and this thing rode up so far and bunched my shirt up underneath it. also- my phone fit (which is good) but getting to it and other things was such a pain in the butt for me. i much prefer a waist pouch with some kind of clip instead of the slip in pull up or pull down and over. it's a great concept but for people like me with big hips- it just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Becky S. Ash

customer_reviews.title: size
customer_reviews.text: I saw some discrepancies about sizes being too large or too small, based on which of two sizing charts people received. I am about 5'6" and 145-150 and measure 32w x 39.5h and the M was fine. I feel like the L would have been too large. Hopefully that'll help someone.
customer_reviews.author: bcarr444

customer_reviews.title: Rides up like crazy!
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to this, I wanted to free up my hands during runs. The item I received was already mildly curled when I opened it, but thought nothing of it. I put it on my hip area like most suggested and it rides up immediately and constantly. So I have tried putting it up on my waist, it rides less (nowhere to go, it gets stopped by my sports bra), but it flops around there. I'm considering trying a smaller size, but I hate to waste my time if that one will do the same. Very frustrating! It is soft and nice material, but does not stay put for anything. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Thompson

customer_reviews.title: It could work
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a cool item for working out hands free as long as you get the correct size. I'have fitting issues my waist is small but hips are much larger. I experienced rolling with the size medium, so I generally have to order several sizes to find the right one of anything. Therefore for me I will probably have to get it in a size large or extra large and just do a slight alteration.
customer_reviews.author: The Blaktygres

customer_reviews.title: A great belt for long runs
customer_reviews.text: Oddly enough this belt was not part of my marathon training even though I had it available. Nonetheless I decided to wear it for a marathon I just ran. It fit my iPhone XS Max with case. I also had 5 gels and could’ve fit more small things if I wanted. The belt did not bother me whatsoever thru the entire marathon run. I would recommend this belt to all runners.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: One less thing to worry about...
customer_reviews.text: During my jogs I have to worry about making sure my dog doesn't drag me after stray cats, keeping an eye out for angry raccoons, and making sure I don't trip over my own feet. The last thing I want to worry about is my phone bouncing around in a fanny pack or in my pocket. Fortunately this product eliminates one of those concerns. Now if Flipbelt can just figure out how to get rid of the raccoons...
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Very good product over all
customer_reviews.text: Flip belt fits securely on my hips though I notice if I go more than 3 miles it does tend to slip up towards my waist and when I push it down it slips down towards my butt at times. Overall I'm very happy with the product, it holds my phone which is a large in one pocket and keys and honey drops in the other for my longer runs. I could fit a water bottle if I want to to but I don't like to carry the weight so I choose not to. I'm happy enough with the product that if I lost it, I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: NS

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: - quite heavy for what it is - its annoying to have to invert it every time you want to get something - not fast drying at all - not great for biking because it ends up digging into your stomach (I don't have a big belly, not sure if it would be better or worse on someone with a big belly - it is quite wide so it takes up a lot of vertical space on your body when you wear it, then the more active/ moving you are, the more it rides up on your stomach and gets annoying - overall I wish I hadn't spent money on it
customer_reviews.author: IIBuc_NastyII

customer_reviews.title: Great for holding phone / keys on a run!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a flip belt for about four years now, and even went so far as to re-purchase when I left mine behind at a hotel while travelling. I usually carry my phone (an iPhone 8 Plus in a protective case - so not a small phone) and keys with me while out, and haven't had an issue with fitting everything yet. I usually spin my phone around to my back in the belt, and haven't really had an issue with bouncing or sliding. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nellie Marvel

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a product to use overseas as a passport belt that was sturdy and subtle. This item was neither. There was not zipper to secure my passport. The belt is not waterproof, I would not trust it in high humidity/sweat environment. Lastly, it was not subtle at all. It was as obvious as a passport belt. I returned it for something that zipped and was water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: FlipBelt Rocks.
customer_reviews.text: The flip belt is awesome. I use it every time I run and at the gym too when I am lifting. I hold my phone in it, with my headphones attached. I run the cord under my shirt so it doesn't get in the way. I also have a house key attached to it and I keep a lip balm in there too. So far, nothing has fallen out. I have 36" hips, and I bought one size smaller - I think it was the L - I don't remember. But it fits my hips nicely and NEVER moves, nor does it bounce around. I would recommend this to runners and for use at the gym as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great running belt!
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this 5 stars because it is the only running belt / band that doesn’t bounce “too” much while running. I had been looking for running belt to hold my phone, pepper spray, and house key, but all the belts (including the Nathan) bounced and moved from my hips to belly button region - this belt stayed in place for the majority of my 6+ mile runs. I’m a size 0 and ordered an XS (perfect fit). Recommend this product :-)
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Uribe Restrepo

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed with sizing
customer_reviews.text: So I wear a small in every type of running short/tights and I purchased the small after reading the reviews on the sizing. Sure, I can get it on, but it is so constricting that it's uncomfortable to run in. This is not a Small size for normal adults.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca Pyko

customer_reviews.title: Running storage for cell phone
customer_reviews.text: It took me a few runs to figure out best way to wear it. I started outside my shorts but then use it under the shorts and over my running tights. Perfect I use it every run. I sweat slot and it absorbs a bunch of sweat so I have to wash it weekly. I hang dry it between days. Over all great. I have a pixel 4 and holds it easy and I have a case. Also I add a few energy packets for running. I keep the phone centered in my front and all works great. I am heavy bought the XL sits perfect. I'm a 38 waist and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Stigs

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I’m a petite person, waist line of 23.5”, and this was too big for me. It sits on my waist instead of stretching it like a belt, so it takes away some of the esthetic points. It isn’t that practice for me since I have to wear it outside, otherwise it’s obvious that I’m wearing something bulky. Otherwise great quality, money felt secure in the belt. iPhone 7 Plus/passport can barely fit as if I almost break the stitches. Overall good quality, wish I was fatter to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Mellazine

customer_reviews.title: Not a good running  belt
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good belt. I barely comment on items I buy but I’m irritated about all the items I’ve lost over the runs. If you go for long runs on roads or trail runs where the ground is uneven things fall off even if you face the openings of the belt up so their not facing out. I’ve lost an AirPod charging case and a small thin air can that I use to carry to scare off dogs or animals. I even dropped my ID card once and thankfully I was running back the same direction and I saw it. Not worth it or the cost of this belt.
customer_reviews.author: C.B

customer_reviews.title: Great thought but very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: my iphone6 plus is a right fit in the belts pocket, hard to get in and out. Once on the belt becomes uncomfortable around mile 3 of my run. The belt/phone flops and is annoying to wear. I tried placing the phone around in multiple areas (front, back, side). When wearing on my back it actually bruised my back! I am training for a 1/2 marathon...in decent shape and measured for a size small. The fit seemed fine but I found the concept to be uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Why did I ever bother with an armband?
customer_reviews.text: I'm just sorry I never got this sooner! It's amazing! Used to use an armband that I would have to change every time I updated my phone, used to slide down or be too tight not comfortable etc... Tried this waistband on my run this morning and was so impressed! I completely forgot it was there! And I have a big iPhone 7 Plus. So comfortable and made the run so much more enjoyable. Seriously worth every penny, how did I live without this? I'm in between an S and a M in clothes and got the S it's perfect. Size down if in doubt, it's very stretchy material!
customer_reviews.author: Dominique Beltran

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely essential
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't jostle, doesn't slip, and keeps items strapped in while you run. It can be difficult to get a post-2018 phone in, but it will fit all but the largest phones (> 6.5"). The belt is easy to slip on and isn't so tight that you feel restricted. I can't imagine running without it! Update (July 19 2020): Still good, but noticing that small, round things like wireless earbud cases slip out relatively easily. I'd keep that in mind as I've had my case slip out during strenuous runs
customer_reviews.author: Andrew V.

customer_reviews.title: So dope!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is DOPE! Sorry I'm just really stoked about it. It doesn't move, keeps all my things (keys, phone, wallet, pepper spray), keeps my shirt from riding up when I run, and is super comfy! Really wanted to get away from arm bands and this is the way to go. Haven't washed it cause I am scared to dry it tbh. I got a small and I'm 5'2" 130lbs. Snug fit but in a good way!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for music festivals, going on a run, or gym
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect. the left side comes with a little attachement (doesn't get in the way or is bothersome) that can be used to attach your keys for extra security. This belt has no real pockets, rather... they're slits that hold onto everything you put in them. I place my keys on the left side, the middle can be used for an item like your phone, and the right side can be used for any little accessories you might be carrying (ID, money, credit card). Useful for people at the gym or music festivals
customer_reviews.author: R M

customer_reviews.title: Stayed in place through my entire run!
customer_reviews.text: So, I was worried after reading some reviews about the size and decided to go with the x-small (I'm a size 2-4 ). The belt fit perfect on my hips the entire run, it never moved! The opening was perfect for my Galaxy s10+ and my phone was very secure . 5 Stars from me!! I would recommend this belt to runners
customer_reviews.author: Gallant

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable running belt I ever wear
customer_reviews.text: I am a marathon runner, and I have many runner's belt. FlipBelt is one of the them that have been recommended by my fellow runners. The build and craftsmanship is excellent. The price is reasonable but it is cover via warranty. Moreover, according to my fellow runner, he has been using the same belt for 2 years. The material is super comfortable and wicked sweat easily. Please note that this is not a water proof belt, your item will get wet if it rains or if you sweat a lot. But it is a great sporting belt to have.
customer_reviews.author: tct

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this belt for when she runs. As with most women's work out gear it is not conducive to carrying a phone, keys or pepper spray. With this belt she is able to keep everything she needs on her and in close range in case she needs to grab something. She does not have to worry about anything bulky on her arms, or something weighing her down. This flip belt is sleek and compact and a perfect fit. She recommended it to half her family and multiple friends already.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Williams

customer_reviews.title: Size up for comfort
customer_reviews.text: Had to size up from medium to large, even though the size chart indicates that I'd take a medium. But once I got a bigger size I live wearing it. I'm 5'6" 150 lbs. I could wear a medium but I don't like something tight on my waist. The large is easy to slip in and out of but doesn't shift around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Original version - NO ZIPPER compartment.
customer_reviews.text: This belt does NOT have a zipper. It is the original model. I returned it to get the model WITH the zipper and I love it. I tried to love this one but I was too nervous my AirPod case or cell phone wasn’t going to slip out of it. Definitely one of the best inventions for runners. I love mine!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Chiudioni

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t meet up with marketing hoopla
customer_reviews.text: I had very high hopes based on marketing. However it didn’t work for me. Mainly because I use an otter box on my iPhone. I have to cause I drop it a lot. It won’t fit in the slots. Also, it keeps riding up from my hip to my waist which isn’t supposed to do since it measured my size. I’ll be looking around for a different style to fit me and my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Ljr nh

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work, too hot
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t serve its purpose! Too many openings. You slide your phone in one opening and the movement from running jostles the phone right out of the next opening (even if you flip the belt with the opening facing your skin). My phone fell out several times on just one run no matter how I positioned it in the belt. Too much fabric, really hot around your waist especially when you’re running.
customer_reviews.author: BrettStimpson

customer_reviews.title: I think this product is a good idea, but only works for people of a ...
customer_reviews.text: 1) does not stay in place 2) bunches up and folds over 3) items will fall out I wanted this to work out for me, but it does not. It rides up off my hips while I run and then proceeds to bunch up and fold over. I measured myself correctly, and bought the appropriate size. Also, if you DO NOT want to lose your keys, clip them on the plastic clip or your keys will fall out. I think this product is a good idea, but only works for people of a certain body shape (not hourglass/pair shaped)
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Does slip up
customer_reviews.text: This is really great for long runs and no arm band beats it in my opinion. It holds lots of stuff and holds it well (haven't had anything drop out). That being said, like many other reviews have pointed out, it does have a tendency on pear shaped bodies to ride up to the waist. To me that isn't a huge deal (its pretty comfortable on the waist as well) but if that is a deal breaker I would avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Very useful but awkward to use. Sizing runs small in our opinion.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter to wear when she’s riding rides at the carnival/amusement park. * She wears size 4 pants. We bought her the medium flip belt. It fits her a bit tight in our opinion but it’s not so bad that we wanted to return/exchange it. * Its a tight fit, but her iPhone 8 Plus fits in the belt. * She wore it all afternoon. She found it useful but complained that it was uncomfortable, hot, and awkward to get resituated when she took something out or put something in or went to the restroom. I wonder if having a larger size might remedy this.
customer_reviews.author: LaurieKay

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I was a bit skeptical when my running friends said that many of them use this to carry along water, keys, and fuel for their long runs during the summer. I thought it would slide down at the waist and be uncomfortable and that the water bottle accessories would be unwieldy. I have been proven wrong. This belt is amazing, it holds fuel, keys, cash, water bottles, and whatever else you can shove into the pockets of it. You don't even know you are wearing it because it is so comfortable. I would recommend this belt to any runner, specifically if you are running outside when it is hot.
customer_reviews.author: Myron TTop Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: I could just have easily cut the waistband off a cheap pair of yoga ...
customer_reviews.text: This is essentially one piece of stretchy fabric. I bought it because I upgraded to a gigantic phone (somebody please bring back the simple flip phone) and it no longer fit my previous running fanny pack. The FlipBelt works does the trip. Taking off one star because a single piece of fabric should not cost $25. I could just have easily cut the waistband off a cheap pair of yoga pants and made my own! Looking forward to the day that Chinese manufacturers steal this intellectual property and resell it for a fraction of this price.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for running/walking
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for all my training runs and recently for my own and first half marathon. Placed it on my waist under my t-shirt because I don't want people to know i'm carrying stuff while running (due to safety reasons). It's true to size, doesn't roll up and only moves sideways, which is fine with me. Sometimes you don't even realise that you are wearing it :) I have carried my phone, three or four energy gels/bars while running. It's not waterproof and the belt will get damp but it doesn't ruin my phone because it has casing on. Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase and can see myself buying another in future.
customer_reviews.author: Mel J

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but is a little bulky
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but is a little bulky, especially if you have a big phone. My iPhone 8 Plus fits inside, but it is definitely bulky. Even with my phone inside, I can still fit things in the other pockets. If you are running with this on, it may slide up depending on what pants you are wearing. I would still prefer this band over an arm band since it is more durable and will not get in your way while exercising.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this to hold my iPhone 6, wallet, keys, and microfiber cloth for my glasses. No one can even tell that I have all of this on me which is always a plus because I hate carrying around a purse. For me and my lazy needs this works well. I also use this whenever I go to the gym and I have the peace of mind of my phone being near me yet not in danger of getting crushed by a weight or being accidentally dropped. *10/10 would recommend*
customer_reviews.author: Hamtj

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not functional.
customer_reviews.text: It holds my stuff but it's really just not a great design. You see, when you put stuff in it's very difficult to make sure the belt is all on the same face- once you wear it a couple times there's no stiffness, so you have to carefully untwist any bunched up parts. Maybe that's fine for some people, but for me, a big sweaty guy, this makes putting the belt on weird. And the sides aren't easy to uniformly flip to- it's not hard to get it stuck in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Meehan

customer_reviews.title: You NEED this!
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of the greatest inventions, and I will definitely be purchasing another! I no longer have to fish through my clothes looking for a pair of leggings with pockets before a run, or get stuck holding my phone while running! This is a game changer, the belt stays in place, and none of my belongings fall out, but my phone is still easily accessible while I run. This is also great for when I walk the dog and want to be hands free. You won’t regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kirr

customer_reviews.title: Gym People Need This!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my flip belt! I use it every time I go to the gym and it is just perfect! It doesn't hinder my workouts or run. It holds my phone in case that it is in. Using my wired earphones with my phone in the belt is easy. I can fit more than one phone if I need to. I used the attached hook for my one house key a couple of times and it worked well. I can't say enough about this product. It was a good investment. The sizing guide is true, so you can trust it. The material is easy to wash in the wash. Very good!
customer_reviews.author: TP_0314

customer_reviews.title: Love it !
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this belt continuously for weeks and find it very comfortable and secure. I have run, biked, and ridden horses without worrying about losing my phone. Fitting a large smartphone into the belt was a bit snug the first few times I used the belt. I thought I would tear it or harm the phone, but after a few insertions I discovered how to slide it in effortlessly. The FlipBelt is very robust, but feels almost undetectable. I like having my phone and lipstick handy without having to empty my pockets when I sit down.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. D.

customer_reviews.title: Not For the Full-bodied and Curvaceous
customer_reviews.text: This belt is well-made of quality materials but of no use to me. I am full-bodied and curvy, with waist proportionately small to my hips. No matter how and where I wore the belt it rode up and flipped. I tried a much wider belt with great success.
customer_reviews.author: Lfaulconer

customer_reviews.title: A runner must have
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this item. if you are not running with a pack this is the item you NEED. has a key slot and can fit a small water bottle in it. i usually keep carb snacks and tissues in mine as well as chapstick and have never had anything fall out. I had the feeling of things bouncing or moving when i run but i do not notice this with this product even when I have it completely full. make sure to buy the waterbottle that goes with this!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Houston

customer_reviews.title: Can't go running without it
customer_reviews.text: This belt is awesome. Easy to use and works great for holding keys and my cell phone and much better than those darn arm phone holders. It stays in place and you don't even know it's there while running. I simply cannot go running without this belt. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lean toward to smaller size
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than an armband. It even fits my giant iPhone plus and I can’t even feel it when I’m running. My husband is 5’8 and 150 lbs and uses a small and I’m 5’6 and 155 lbs and use a medium. I would go a size smaller if you’re undecided since it’s very stretchy and doesn’t work as well if it’s not tight.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa8631

customer_reviews.title: Works Great but Looks Stupid
customer_reviews.text: My phone is bulky, and their tiny water bottle sticks out and looks super stupid. So I put it in my back to avoid looking at it. But five stars because I don't want to have my phone on my arm, I want to carry water and towel while running outside, so it works better around the waist than storing them in a pocket. The medium was too small for 5'4", 150 lbs. The large works better for 5'4, 150 lbs and also 5'8", 150 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Monster Mom

customer_reviews.title: Best waist pack for running hands down.
customer_reviews.text: This belt is exactly what I needed for running. I can hold my phone, tissues, doggy poo bags, everything! I followed the size guide and went with a small. I’m a sz 4. If I could change anything it may be to add silicone grips inside to keep it from creeping up while I run but it wasn’t a big deal to adjust. Definitely way better than a bouncy fanny pack! Also, the color is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Convenient running waistband! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love this for running! Holds my iPhone, keys, whatever I need. I do find it runs small - I’m almost always an XS in clothes and a 24 or 25 in jeans, but felt more comfortable in a size Small in this (I had originally ordered size XS and exchanged). So, you may want to size up unless you like a tight fit!
customer_reviews.author: Claire M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor materials not for running
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product just because of its rating. Completely disappointed. This seems to be good for walking etc. Definitely not for running. Biggest drawbacks 1) Neither water resistant nor water proof. After couple of km when i started sweating badly my phone inside was all wet 2) I kept my small headphone charger which after few distance just came out and fell on the ground, very annoying 3) once its wet looks like it will take ages to dry out. Not enough thought process given to design this product. Will not recommend for hard core runners and intense physical activities. Definitely not worth of money.
customer_reviews.author: Soumya Pattnayak

customer_reviews.title: Alternate use
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine has one and she let me check it out. I immediately ordered one. My purpose for it though is more than just to hold my cell phone, keys, etc. I use mine to hold my insulin pump. In some outfits, dresses and such there is no where for me to put my pump that won't fall out but with this a loose fitting dress works wonderful!!! I only wish it came in a beige color so I could wear it under dresses.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cross

customer_reviews.title: Perfect running belt!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a fan of most running belts. They are generally bulky and bothersome. This one fits perfect, stays in place, and I forget it’s there. I should have invested in this a LONG time ago! I wish I would have had one when I ran my half marathon! I generally run anywhere from 3-6 miles, and the only thing I worry about not is if I’m going to finish before I run out of daylight!
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: The tag attached to the belt indicates that the M (waist size 29-32) is a size 6-8, while the large is a size 10-12. I'm an 8-10 in clothes, and I wish I ordered a size up -- the M is a bit constricting and feels like a lot around the waist when I put it on over the elastic waistband of shorts. That said, I'm still using it and it stays in place, keeps my large phone in place and doesn't bother me while running.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Regis

customer_reviews.title: no zippers!
customer_reviews.text: this is great, except if you have anything small to put in here, best of luck. there are no zippers, just slits in the fabric. I must have picked up my house key 834i3257654361 times while running the other day. other than the fact it can't hold much of anything, its pretty sweet
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: I can not say enough great things about the belt
customer_reviews.text: I am a new runner and I hate running... I have been carrying my phone either in my legging pocket or a fanny pack when I ran and the fanny pack kept bouncing up and down and was really annoying. I came across this item on a YouTube video and I bought it and I can truly say it’s worth every penny. It fits my phone and keys in there and it doesn’t bounce when I run.
customer_reviews.author: cici

customer_reviews.title: Not for all body shapes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent idea & the fabric is great! I think for me, it’s not the right solution for holding my phone, etc. while I exercise. I have a small waist and larger stomach & hips/butt. It felt bulky and bulged in areas where I can’t afford the extra lumps. Because my waist is smaller, it rode up off my hips and flopped around my waist. Awkward to take on & off and thicker than I thought it would be. I really wanted this to work for me!! I think if I were built differently, it would have been 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lb*cake

customer_reviews.title: Measure where you want to wear it
customer_reviews.text: I bought a small for my daughter and the first time she came back from a run while wearing it she said it worked great, held everything in place. So I decided to order myself one. According to the sizing I needed a large, but unless I wear it four inches below my belly button it is too lose. I should have ordered a medium, but I will still try to run with it and see how well it stays.
customer_reviews.author: Ami Jordan

customer_reviews.title: I love this waist pouch
customer_reviews.text: I love this waist pouch. My iPhone 6plus fits in it easily and I love the clip to hold my key. I just never could get an arm band to feel comfortable, then it was a pain to get the phone out if I needed to make a call or wanted to take a photo. The phone slips in and out of the flip belt quickly, the band is slim and very comfortable - easy to slip on and off and you can wear it high or low depending on your pants or what you feel is comfortable and it stays in place when you are moving. great product.
customer_reviews.author: Root

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Stays put.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after a recommendation and LOVE it. I’m a new runner and this solves my problem of carrying my phone or money when running. It stays put and does not move. It has many pockets and a key latch. I’m size 6 and bought a S ( because it has stretch). It sits well a little above my hip bone. It’s a good size for me as I didn’t want it to be tight. It’ll still fit me if I lose a few inches.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Good but Floppy
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, holds my large S9+, but I still feel the phone flop against my waist. Could be just because I have such a large phone or maybe I ordered the wrong size? Unfortunately I already used it once so will keep and use for my walks instead. Ordered a large. I am 5'7 and 146 pounds. Have had 3 babies so definitely have the little mom pooch but don't exact measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Delores Matich

customer_reviews.title: Choose size wisely
customer_reviews.text: It’s good, very useful when you don’t want to carry a purse you can put your keys, credit card but your phone is a different story you can put it in but if it’s large like many phone nowadays or you have a case on it, it may be difficult to put it in and take out and may be uncomfortable. Men may have difficulties putting there wallet in or out especially if it’s big. If you’re a size medium chose a size large if you want your phone/wallet with you it will be more comfortable when you run. Also I recommend you put the holes towards you, avoid anything from accidentally falling out.
customer_reviews.author: ZCSO

customer_reviews.title: Buy TWO
customer_reviews.text: How did I run without this? OMG, you cannot feel them on you. There is NO bouncing, no sliding, nothing. In fact, I am buying a second pair after I finish writing this. DO follow the sizing instructions as to not be disappointed if they do not do what I said. They do get wet...so they need a wash after a few runs, though wanting to have a spare pair. You will love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Reina Del Rio

customer_reviews.title: Motion-free phone holder for running
customer_reviews.text: I like to run with music and my tracking app but got an iphone 8plus and thought I'd have to leave it behind. I'm a medium-sized woman but purcased the small because I didn't want it to be loose. The pouch worked great - I forgot I had my phone! There was no motion or discomfort of items pressing into me as I ran. I did struggle to get back to my music after taking a call. This is the perfect accessory if you don't need frequent access to the items you're storing in it.
customer_reviews.author: Portland Amy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Running Belt
customer_reviews.text: This is a great belt, both for running and when I don't feel like carrying a bag but have to hold my phone, keys, and whatever else. It does look a bit bulky when I tuck my iPhone 8 Plus in there, but at least it doesn't jostle around. My waist size is ~27, and I got an XS because I like a tighter fit. I'm glad I didn't get the S because the XS is perfect. A larger size would have been too loose.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Running with a phone bouncing around in a pocket of my shorts is annoying, and it could result in the phone falling out. So I bought the basic FlipBelt, and it's great. I slip the phone in (after removing the case), flip the belt so the side with openings is facing me, and then (unless I think I'll need to retrieve it while running) swivel the FlipBelt around so the phone is nestled in the small of my back. Then I forget about it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Adams

customer_reviews.title: This Belt is AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my flip belt. I have used it to carry my iPhone 7, my sport beans (while running), car keys, and even my debit card/cash. I wore it for my entire half marathon and pretty much all training runs. It holds my stuff securely - no bouncing at all... I don't even know it's there. Nothing has ever fallen out of it, but the openings allow me to connect my earbuds to my phone easily for solo runs. If you ever need to carry anything with you while running, this is the belt for you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but size down!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you don't just try it on to see if it fits... put it on, put some heavy stuff in there, bounce around, and if there's any movement at all you need to go down a size. When you are wearing it and it gets wet from sweat, it gets even heavier and looser.
customer_reviews.author: K & N

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second FlipBelt. I wear my first one religiously when I workout. I needed to get a second one due to m the increased workout regimine. It has not disappointed. It is easy to use (just slip it on). They are a perfect width to hold larger cell phone and they have a clasp for your keys. It is easy to clean also. Now this is the original patent so it doesn't have any zippers, just fyi. Honestly, though, I've put anything from money to keys to my cell phone in it and nothing has fallen out yet. Much better than the cell phone holders that go on your arm!
customer_reviews.author: Elle_Mac

customer_reviews.title: Handy for phone and keys
customer_reviews.text: I got a new phone and needed some place to hold it while I run. I previously had an armband, but with the size of my new phone (with an otterbox) I wanted something easier to use. I have an 8 plus with a defender otter box and it just fits. It's snug, but I think that works well for not shifting around while I run. I purchased a smaller size than recommended because I didn't want it sliding down as I ran, and I'm glad I did because it fits just right. I clip my keys in and that works well. But, I have yet to trust it with my DL or CC. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: well made belt for carrying lots of things
customer_reviews.text: perfect for carrying my medical device under my clothes so that i don’t have to wear it around my neck! also very useful for carrying keys, poop bags and my phone while walking my dog. i love that you can wear it under your clothes and it’s not bulky!
customer_reviews.author: blitz88

product_meta.title: FlipBelt - USA Original Patent, USA Designed, USA Shipped, USA Warranty
product_meta.description:
The FlipBelt is a really simple but revolutionary product to go hands free. Made of machine-washable high tech Spandex-Lycra blend material with an internal pocket system accessible from four openings around the belts exterior. The four pockets lets you easily tuck in your phone, keys, gel packs, credit cards or whatever you may need for your workout. You then flip the belt inside out and everything gets locked in place. Because there are no clasps or buttons, you simply pull the belt on like a pair of pants and wear it wherever it feels most comfortable. It doesn't move, jiggle, bounce or chafe and you could easily forget it's even there. A simple, elegant and fashionable solution to a problem for all active types, gym rats, runners, hikers, bikers, and travelers. Weighing a mere 3 ounces, the FlipBelt is so sleek you can even wear it to go out under your clothes without having to carry a wallet or purse. Order one size up or down
